history.content:
I basically took this schedule last semester but with 61A instead of 61C, and it was quite manageable for me.  I don't doubt 61C is more work/harder than 61A, but if you are confident in your math skills, then Math 54 and EE16A should be pretty simple.  

In addition, first midterm for 54 and 16A are almost identical. Then material from second midterm of 54 also overlaps with the final third of EE16A (middle portion is circuits).  

Maybe half of EE16A is material you learn in 54 so it should  be easier.

As for which one to choose, I personally enjoyed 54 and all the math and even the differential equations.  I felt it was easier, but it depends on professor (I had Srivastava).

EE16A gives you circuits if that is more interesting to you.

As long as you keep pace with the essays for your R1B class, the workload should not be too bad for your R1B, EE16A, and Math 54.

Then you can dedicate some time for 61C.

On the other hand, if you struggled with math previously, the proofs/concepts and circuits might take a large chunk of your studying.   Then again, imo, linear algebra was relatively straightforward.

________________________________

In regards to the above answer, in my opinion (and probably most), 61c is significantly harder and more of a time commitment than 61a. Keep that in mind when planning your schedule

children.subject: You'll probably need some 54 for 194-26 as well. So no, not for most upper div's but anything graphics or image related will build upon some of that knowledge.

history.content:
Hello, 

I am considering taking EE 16A, Math 54, 61C, and an R1B all next semester. Can someone help me decide if this is reasonably feasible? If I have a choice between 16A and 54, which should I take?

Thank you!
history.subject: Estimated workload: EE 16A, Math 54, 61C, R1B
